head.title: Bush Calls Kohl On Trade Talks

identified-content.org: GENERAL AGREEMENT ON TARIFFS AND TRADE (GATT)

hedline.hl1: Bush Calls Kohl On Trade Talks

block.p: President Bush called the German Chancellor, Helmut Kohl, on Monday to discuss the collapse of international trade talks, the White House said today.
The Presidential spokesman, Marlin Fitzwater, said the two leaders discussed the importance of getting the trade talks "started up again."

The talks, under the auspices of the General Agreement on Tariffs and Trade, were suspended earlier this month after the United States and the 12-nation European Community failed to agree on restricting farm-product subsidies. The United States would like to see the subsidies phased out.
President Bush called the German Chancellor, Helmut Kohl, on Monday to discuss the collapse of international trade talks, the White House said today.

The talks, under the auspices of the General Agreement on Tariffs and Trade, were suspended earlier this month after the United States and the 12-nation European Community failed to agree on restricting farm-product subsidies. The United States would like to see the subsidies phased out.
